info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Big Horn and eastern Carbon Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Bridger, or 27 miles east of Red Lodge, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail, along with brief very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pryor and Warren. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for south central Montana.
